title: Happiness is a choice
description: "Happiness is a choice that requires effort at times." - Aeschylus

title: Count your age by friends
description: "Count your age by friends, not years. Count your life by smiles, not tears." - John Lennon

title: The purpose of our lives
description: "The purpose of our lives is to be happy." - Dalai Lama XIV

title: Happiness is not by chance
description: "Happiness is not by chance, but by choice." - Jim Rohn

title: Be happy for this moment
description: "Be happy for this moment. This moment is your life." - Omar Khayyam

title: Happiness depends upon ourselves
description: "Happiness depends upon ourselves." - Aristotle

title: The secret of happiness
description: "The secret of happiness is freedom, the secret of freedom is courage." - Thucydides

title: Happiness is a warm puppy
description: "Happiness is a warm puppy." - Charles M. Schulz

title: The best way to cheer yourself
description: "The best way to cheer yourself up is to try to cheer somebody else up." - Mark Twain

title: Happiness is not something ready-made
description: "Happiness is not something ready-made. It comes from your own actions." - Dalai Lama XIV

title: Tears are words that need to be written
description: "Tears are words that need to be written." - Paulo Coelho

title: The good life is not one immune to sadness
description: "The good life is not one immune to sadness but one in which suffering contributes to our development." - Alain de Botton

title: Behind every sweet smile
description: "Behind every sweet smile, there is a bitter sadness that no one can ever see and feel." - Tupac Shakur

title: Sadness flies away on the wings of time
description: "Sadness flies away on the wings of time." - Jean de La Fontaine

title: There is a sacredness in tears
description: "There is a sacredness in tears. They are not the mark of weakness, but of power." - Washington Irving

title: The word 'happy' would lose its meaning
description: "The word 'happy' would lose its meaning if it were not balanced by sadness." - Carl Jung

title: Sadness gives depth
description: "Sadness gives depth. Happiness gives height. Sadness gives roots. Happiness gives branches." - Osho

title: Every man has his secret sorrows
description: "Every man has his secret sorrows which the world knows not; and often times we call a man cold when he is only sad." - Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

title: The worst kind of sad
description: "The worst kind of sad is not being able to explain why." - Unknown

title: Tears come from the heart
description: "Tears come from the heart and not from the brain." - Leonardo da Vinci

title: Holding onto anger
description: "Holding onto anger is like drinking poison and expecting the other person to die." - Buddha

title: Speak when you are angry
description: "Speak when you are angry and you will make the best speech you will ever regret." - Ambrose Bierce

title: For every minute you are angry
description: "For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness." - Ralph Waldo Emerson

title: Anger is an acid
description: "Anger is an acid that can do more harm to the vessel in which it is stored than to anything on which it is poured." - Mark Twain

title: When angry, count to four
description: "When angry, count to four; when very angry, swear." - Mark Twain

title: Anger is a brief madness
description: "Anger is a brief madness." - Horace

title: Anger is one letter short of danger
description: "Anger is only one letter short of danger." - Eleanor Roosevelt

title: The best fighter
description: "The best fighter is never angry." - Lao Tzu

title: Whatever is begun in anger
description: "Whatever is begun in anger, ends in shame." - Benjamin Franklin

title: Anger is never without a reason
description: "Anger is never without a reason, but seldom with a good one." - Benjamin Franklin

title: Fear makes the wolf bigger
description: "Fear makes the wolf bigger than he is." - German Proverb

title: I learned that courage
description: "I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it." - Nelson Mandela

title: The only thing we have to fear
description: "The only thing we have to fear is fear itself." - Franklin D. Roosevelt

title: Fear is the mind-killer
description: "Fear is the mind-killer. Fear is the little-death that brings total obliteration." - Frank Herbert

title: Don't be afraid of your fears
description: "Don't be afraid of your fears. They're not there to scare you. They're there to let you know that something is worth it." - C. JoyBell C.

title: Fear doesn't shut you down
description: "Fear doesn't shut you down; it wakes you up." - Veronica Roth

title: Fear is a reaction
description: "Fear is a reaction. Courage is a decision." - Winston Churchill

title: Everything you want is on the other side of fear
description: "Everything you want is on the other side of fear." - Jack Canfield

title: We can easily forgive a child
description: "We can easily forgive a child who is afraid of the dark; the real tragedy of life is when men are afraid of the light." - Plato

title: Do the thing you fear
description: "Do the thing you fear and the death of fear is certain." - Ralph Waldo Emerson

title: I love you without knowing how
description: "I love you without knowing how, or when, or from where. I love you simply, without problems or pride." - Pablo Neruda

title: You don't love someone for their looks
description: "You don't love someone for their looks, or their clothes, or for their fancy car, but because they sing a song only you can hear." - Oscar Wilde

title: I fell in love the way you fall asleep
description: "I fell in love the way you fall asleep: slowly, and then all at once." - John Green

title: We loved with a love that was more than love
description: "We loved with a love that was more than love." - Edgar Allan Poe

title: You have bewitched me
description: "You have bewitched me, body and soul, and I love... I love... I love you." - Jane Austen

title: Love is like the wind
description: "Love is like the wind, you can't see it but you can feel it." - Nicholas Sparks

title: I would rather spend one lifetime with you
description: "I would rather spend one lifetime with you, than face all the ages of this world alone." - J.R.R. Tolkien

title: Whatever our souls are made of
description: "Whatever our souls are made of, his and mine are the same." - Emily Brontë

title: If I know what love is
description: "If I know what love is, it is because of you." - Hermann Hesse

title: To love or have loved
description: "To love or have loved, that is enough. Ask nothing further. There is no other pearl to be found in the dark folds of life." - Victor Hugo

title: The time to relax
description: "The time to relax is when you don't have time for it." - Sydney J. Harris

title: Almost everything will work again
description: "Almost everything will work again if you unplug it for a few minutes, including you." - Anne Lamott

title: Your mind will answer most questions
description: "Your mind will answer most questions if you learn to relax and wait for the answer." - William S. Burroughs

title: Sometimes the most productive thing
description: "Sometimes the most productive thing you can do is relax." - Mark Black

title: There is virtue in work and there is virtue in rest
description: "There is virtue in work and there is virtue in rest. Use both and overlook neither." - Alan Cohen

title: Rest is not idleness
description: "Rest is not idleness, and to lie sometimes on the grass under trees on a summer's day, listening to the murmur of the water, or watching the clouds float across the sky, is by no means a waste of time." - John Lubbock

title: Sometimes you need to sit lonely on the floor
description: "Sometimes you need to sit lonely on the floor in a quiet room in order to hear your own voice and not let it drown in the noise of others." - Charlotte Eriksson

title: Tension is who you think you should be
description: "Tension is who you think you should be. Relaxation is who you are." - Chinese Proverb

title: Life isn't as serious as the mind makes it out to be
description: "Life isn't as serious as the mind makes it out to be." - Eckhart Tolle

title: Don't underestimate the value of doing nothing
description: "Don't underestimate the value of Doing Nothing, of just going along, listening to all the things you can't hear, and not bothering." - A.A. Milne

title: Not all those who wander are lost
description: "Not all those who wander are lost." - J.R.R. Tolkien

title: Sometimes when you lose your way
description: "Sometimes when you lose your way, you find YOURSELF." - Mandy Hale

title: If you feel lost
description: "If you feel lost, disappointed, hesitant, or weak, return to yourself, to who you are, here and now and when you get there, you will discover yourself, like a lotus flower in full bloom, even in a muddy pond." - Masaru Emoto

title: Lost time is never found again
description: "Lost time is never found again." - Benjamin Franklin

title: The soul that sees beauty
description: "The soul that sees beauty may sometimes walk alone." - Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

title: To be yourself in a world
description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." - Ralph Waldo Emerson

title: The hardest thing to find
description: "The hardest thing to find is the thing that's right in front of your face." - Michael Scott

title: We must be willing to let go
description: "We must be willing to let go of the life we planned so as to have the life that is waiting for us." - Joseph Campbell

title: The only journey is the journey within
description: "The only journey is the journey within." - Rainer Maria Rilke

title: Being lost isn't the same as being nowhere
description: "Being lost isn't the same as being nowhere. Being lost is being somewhere, but without knowing where that somewhere is." - Eva Rice

title: The greatest weapon against stress
description: "The greatest weapon against stress is our ability to choose one thought over another." - William James

title: Stress is not what happens to us
description: "Stress is not what happens to us. It's our response to what happens. And response is something we can choose." - Maureen Killoran

title: It's not stress that kills us
description: "It's not stress that kills us, it is our reaction to it." - Hans Selye

title: For fast-acting relief
description: "For fast-acting relief, try slowing down." - Lily Tomlin

title: The day she let go of the things
description: "The day she let go of the things that were weighing her down was the day she began to shine the brightest." - Katrina Mayer

title: When you feel overwhelmed
description: "When you feel overwhelmed, remember: A little at a time is how it gets done. One thing, one task, one moment at a time." - Unknown

title: Life isn't about waiting for the storm to pass
description: "Life isn't about waiting for the storm to pass, it's about learning to dance in the rain." - Vivian Greene

title: Much of the stress people encounter
description: "Much of the stress that people feel doesn't come from having too much to do. It comes from not finishing what they've started." - David Allen

title: If you ask what is the single most important key
description: "If you ask what is the single most important key to longevity, I would have to say it is avoiding worry, stress and tension. And if you didn't ask me, I'd still have to say it." - George Burns

title: Stress should be a powerful driving force
description: "Stress should be a powerful driving force, not an obstacle." - Bill Phillips

title: Sleep is the best meditation
description: "Sleep is the best meditation." - Dalai Lama

title: A good laugh and a long sleep
description: "A good laugh and a long sleep are the best cures in the doctor's book." - Irish Proverb

title: Sleep is that golden chain
description: "Sleep is that golden chain that ties health and our bodies together." - Thomas Dekker

title: Never go to bed mad
description: "Never go to bed mad. Stay up and fight." - Phyllis Diller

title: A well-spent day brings happy sleep
description: "A well-spent day brings happy sleep." - Leonardo da Vinci

title: Sleep is the interest we have to pay
description: "Sleep is the interest we have to pay on the capital which is called in at death; and the higher the rate of interest and the more regularly it is paid, the further the date of redemption is postponed." - Arthur Schopenhauer

title: There is a time for many words
description: "There is a time for many words, and there is also a time for sleep." - Homer

title: Man is a genius when he is dreaming
description: "Man is a genius when he is dreaming." - Akira Kurosawa

title: Sleep is the best cure for waking troubles
description: "Sleep is the best cure for waking troubles." - Miguel de Cervantes

title: Even a soul submerged in sleep
description: "Even a soul submerged in sleep is hard at work and helps make something of the world." - Heraclitus
